com.coding.exercise.service

Interface StockService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    YahooFinanceStockService

    public interface StockService
    Provides methods to add / remove stocks from a watch list and query information about watched stocks.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String[] addStock(java.lang.String symbol)
      Adds a stock to the watch list.
      java.math.BigDecimal getAverageStockPrice(java.lang.String symbol, java.lang.String startDateString, java.lang.String endDateString)
      Provides the average closing price of a stock over the specified date range.
      StockPrice[] getLatestPricesForWatchList()
      Gets the latest prices for all stocks in the current watch list.
      java.lang.String[] getWatchlist()
      Gets the current watch list.
      void removeAllStocks()
      Removes all stocks from the watch list.
      java.lang.String[] removeStock(java.lang.String symbol)
      Removes a stock from the watch list.

    • Method Detail

      • addStock

        java.lang.String[] addStock(java.lang.String symbol)
                     throws InvalidStockSymbolException,
                            java.io.IOException
        Adds a stock to the watch list.
        Parameters:
        symbol - Stock symbol
        Returns:
        A String array containing all of the stocks currently watched.
        Throws:
        InvalidStockSymbolException - Is thrown when the stock symbol is not valid.
        java.io.IOException - Is thrown when the end date is sooner than the start date

      • removeStock

        java.lang.String[] removeStock(java.lang.String symbol)
        Removes a stock from the watch list.
        Parameters:
        symbol -
        Returns:
        Stock symbol

      • removeAllStocks

        void removeAllStocks()
        Removes all stocks from the watch list.

      • getWatchlist

        java.lang.String[] getWatchlist()
        Gets the current watch list.
        Returns:
        A String array containing all of the stocks currently watched

      • getLatestPricesForWatchList

        StockPrice[] getLatestPricesForWatchList()
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Gets the latest prices for all stocks in the current watch list.
        Returns:
        An array of StockPrice objects, each containing the stock symbol and latest price.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getAverageStockPrice

        java.math.BigDecimal getAverageStockPrice(java.lang.String symbol,
                                          java.lang.String startDateString,
                                          java.lang.String endDateString)
                                   throws StockNotInWatchlistException,
                                          java.text.ParseException,
                                          java.io.IOException,
                                          InvalidDatesException
        Provides the average closing price of a stock over the specified date range.
        Parameters:
        symbol - Stock symbol
        startDateString - Start date in YYYY-MM-DD format
        endDateString - End date in YYYY-MM-DD format
        Returns:
        A BigDecimal object with the average closing price for the specified date range.
        Throws:
        StockNotInWatchlistException - Is thrown when the symbol specified is not in the watch list.
        java.text.ParseException - Is thrown when the date format for start or end date is not in the proper format.
        java.io.IOException - Is thrown when there is an error retrieving the stock price from an external system.
        InvalidDatesException - Is thrown when the end date is sooner than the start date
